titlestmt.titleproper: Downingtown Industrial and Agricultural School records 1907-1985
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

publicationstmt.publisher: Temple University - Charles L. Blockson Afro-American Collection

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Downingtown Industrial and Agricultural School records
did.repository: Temple University - Charles L. Blockson Afro-American Collection

bioghist.p: Downingtown Industrial and Agricultural School was located in East Brandywine Township, Chester County, Pennsylvania and operated from 1904 until 1993. In 2002 Delaware County Community College opened its Chester County Campus on the school's former site.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of records of the Downington Industrial and Agricultural School. Materials include: minutes of the Corporation, 1907-1929; minutes of the Executive Committee, 1911-1921, including some financial material; a 1950 insurance survey; a 1972 yearbook; scrapbooks of clippings, programs, and ephemera, 1912-1943; photos of sports teams (1931 and 1932); a 1925 photo album of student life, belonging to George B. Lomax; certificates, photos, and year book of Vivian Evans, class of 1933; school catalogs and information circulars; commencement programs (1951-1984, not complete); several issues of the Downingtown News Letter (1960s); copies of the Downingtown Bulletin from 1933 and 1944; a president's report from 1907; and a grade book from 1918-1919.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
